title: Calories in IPA Beer
meta_description: Learn calories in IPA beer for a standard 12 oz serving, including carbs, protein, sodium, and tweaks for different ABV levels.
assumptions: Standard 12 fl oz (355 ml) bottle or can of India Pale Ale (IPA), ~6.5% ABV, craft brew style, no added sugars.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, ABV, hops, and brewing method. Check labels for specific products.

quick_answer.text: A 12 oz IPA beer contains about 210 kcal, primarily from alcohol and carbohydrates.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in a 12 oz IPA beer?
faqs.a: Approximately 210 kcal for a standard 6.5% ABV IPA.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in IPA beer?
faqs.a: About 14 g of carbohydrates per 12 oz serving, mostly from malt.

faqs.q: Does IPA beer have protein or fat?
faqs.a: Roughly 2 g protein and 0 g fat per 12 oz serving.

faqs.q: Why do IPAs have more calories than lagers?
faqs.a: Higher alcohol content and hop/malt profile increase calories compared to lighter beers.

faqs.q: How does ABV affect calories in IPA beer?
faqs.a: Higher ABV (e.g., 8%) adds ~50-80 kcal per serving due to more alcohol.
